ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a lot about artists i had previously not known about, and i learned about what to look for in works of art and how to appreciate it

The biggest thing I learned is the idea of the critique and how to properly question artist motive. Going in, I was not sure what to expect but through our discussions I feel I have better perspective about my own work. I also received exposure to other type of artists (the class is filled with graphic designers, film artists, photographers, and painters). The seminar is focused on process and the reason for doing what we do.

In this course, we were able to develop our artistic practice by becoming more familiar with other aspects to a practice outside of art making, such as artist statement writing, or the reading of important, informative, and generative texts. We read the works of famous philosophers, culture critics, and art historians, as well as had an opportunity to discuss our own work at length.
Amazing class. I really learned about myself as an artist and the necessary history to feel connected to the artist community.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course was very good, though i wish there would have been more trips to art galleries around New Haven.

Because the course falls in the art department, and is part of the art major, there was a sufficient amount of art making and conversation around our own work. I do believe that at times, the class would have benefited from slightly more reading to inform our art practice.

We went to Jonathan's home and spoke with him individually and gained a real connection with him and the subject matter. It was a really incredible class and great learning experience. Getting to see everyone else's work and show your own in order to develop your style was great.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Its a required course for art/ computing in the arts majors.

If you are in the art major, this course is so beneficial to your growth. Being surrounded by other artists in your year, who are just as eager as you are to make and speak on your work, is such an empowering experience.
I would absolutely recommend it. You gain a greater understanding of who you are as an artist and of the art community as a whole. It's an incredible learning experience.
